greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Characteristic function of the prime powers p^k, k >= 1.
comment: Also, number of Galois fields of order n. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 12 2008
link: Daniel Forgues, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..100000.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{d divides n} bigomega(d)*mu(n/d); equivalently, Sum_{d divides n} a(d) = bigomega(n); equivalently, Möbius transform of bigomega(n).
Dirichlet g.f.: ppzeta(s). Here ppzeta(s) = Sum_{p prime} Sum_{k>=1} 1/(p^k)^s. Note that ppzeta(s) = Sum_{p prime} 1/(p^s - 1) = Sum_{k>=1} primezeta(k*s). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Sep 11 2005
a(n) = floor(1/A001221(n)), for n > 1. - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Jun 01 2011
program: a069513 n = a010055 n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 19 2013
xref: The partial sums of this sequence give A025528. - _Daniel Forgues_, Mar 02 2009
Cf. A014963, A003418. - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Jun 01 2011
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 15 2002
ext: Moved original definition to formula line. Used comment (that I previously added) as definition. - _Daniel Forgues_, Mar 08 2009
